title: Alzheimer 's in the U.S : lifetime risks , by age and gender
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 2 groups Men, and Women. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Risk Percentage.
For Country 65 years, Women had the highest Risk Percentage 211.0 among the 2 groups and in 45 years, Men had the lowest Risk Percentage 103.0.
There is a gap of 95.0 between the highest and lowest Risk Percentage found for Women in Country 65 years and 45 years.
Averaging all 2 groups Men, and Women, the Country 65 years is the maximum Risk Percentage and 45 years is the minimum Risk Percentage.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 2 groups Men, and Women. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Risk Percentage.
Out of all 2 groups, Women had the highest Risk Percentage for Country 65 years and Men had the lowest Risk Percentage for Country 45 years.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 2 groups Men, and Women. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Risk Percentage.
For Country 65 years, Women had the highest Risk Percentage 211.0 among the 2 groups and in 45 years, Men had the lowest Risk Percentage 103.0.
There is a gap of 95.0 between the highest and lowest Risk Percentage found for Women in Country 65 years and 45 years.
Averaging all 2 groups Men, and Women, the Country 65 years is the maximum Risk Percentage and 45 years is the minimum Risk Percentage.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 2 groups Men, and Women. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Risk Percentage.
For Country 65 years, Women had the highest Risk Percentage 211.0 among the 2 groups and in 45 years, Men had the lowest Risk Percentage 103.0.
Among all the Countrys, Women had the highest Risk Percentage 211.0 in Country 65 years and lowest value 116.0 in Country 45 years.
Country 65 years and 45 years had the biggest gap of 95.0 between the highest and lowest Risk Percentage found for Women.
Among all 2 groups, Men had the gap of 92.0 between the maximum and minimum Risk Percentage observed in Country 65 years and 45 years respectively.
On average, the Country 65 years had the highest Risk Percentage for all 2 groups Men, and Women. Whereas 45 years had the lowest average Risk Percentage.
